contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Albums --> | Name = Frankenchrist | Type = studio | Artist = [[Dead Kennedys]] | Cover = Dead Kennedys - Frankenchrist cover.jpg | Released = October 1985 | Recorded = Hyde St. Studios, May & July 1985 | Genre = [[Hardcore punk]] | Length = 45:12 | Label = [[Alternative Tentacles]] | Producer = [[Jello Biafra]] | Last album = ''[[A Skateboard Party]]''<br /> (1983) | This album = '''''Frankenchrist''''' <br /> (1985) | Next album = ''[[Bedtime for Democracy]]''<br /> (1986) | Misc = }} '''''Frankenchrist''''' is the third album released by the American [[hardcore punk]] band [[Dead Kennedys]] in 1985 on [[Alternative Tentacles]]. The album is an example of the progressive, psychedelic side of the Kennedys' musical personality. The [[Spaghetti Western|spaghetti western]] soundtrack influence is also noticeable in the horn parts and in [[East Bay Ray]]'s atmospheric guitar work. Frankenchrist is noted for its relative lack of traditionally '[[Hardcore_punk|hardcore]]' material. Most of the songs are slower and longer than the majority of other Dead Kennedys songs. "M.T.V. − Get off the Air" is notable for its pointed slam of the music establishment and "Stars and Stripes of Corruption" for its exegesis of Biafra's political philosophies. {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|3.5|5}} [{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r5253|pure_url=yes}} link] | rev2 = [[Piero Scaruffi]] | rev2Score = {{Rating|6.5|10}} [http://www.scaruffi.com/vol4/deadkenn.html link] | noprose = yes }} ==Controversy== The album was a subject of controversy because of a poster inserted in the original record sleeve. The poster, [[H. R. Giger]]'s ''Landscape #XX'', or [[Penis Landscape]], was a painting depicting rows of penises and vulvae. The band's vocalist was brought to trial for distributing harmful matter to minors, and though the case did not result in a conviction, [[Jello Biafra]]'s [[Alternative Tentacles]] was driven almost to bankruptcy. Only through the support of fans was the label able to stay alive. Biafra gained attention as a champion of free speech, and was subsequently one of the most active opponents of the [[Parents Music Resource Center]]. The cover itself depicts a [[Shriner]]s parade. ==Track listing== * All music written by Dead Kennedys. All lyrics written by [[Jello Biafra]] except when stated. # "Soup Is Good Food" – 4:18 # "Hellnation" ([[D.H. Peligro]]) – 2:22 # "This Could Be Anywhere (This Could Be Everywhere)" – 5:24 # "A Growing Boy Needs His Lunch" – 5:50 # "Chicken Farm" – 5:06 # "Jock-O-Rama (Invasion of the Beef Patrol)" – 4:06 # "Goons of Hazzard" – 4:25 # "M.T.V. - Get off the Air" – 3:37 # "At My Job" ([[East Bay Ray]]) – 3:41 # "Stars and Stripes of Corruption" – 6:23 == Credits == {| |valign="top"| * [[Jello Biafra]] - lead vocals, producer, mixer * [[East Bay Ray]] - guitar, synthesizer, bellzouki, acoustic guitar in "MTV - Get off the Air" * [[Klaus Flouride]] - bass, backing vocals <!-- sic --> * [[D.H. Peligro]] - drums, backing vocals * John Leib - trumpet on "MTV - Get Off The Air" * Tim Jones - keyboards on "A Growing Boy Needs His Lunch" * Nina T.R. Stapleton - backing vocals * Laura T.R. Muetz - backing vocals |valign="top"| * Julie Hoffman - backing vocals * Susan Caldwell - backing vocals * Danielle Dunlap - backing vocals * Robyn Lutz - backing vocals * Kris Carleson - backing vocals * Steve DePace - backing vocals * Wild Bill - backing vocals * Sweet - backing vocals |valign="top"| * Wee Willy Lipat - backing vocals * Microwave - backing vocals * Gary Floyd - backing vocals * Eugene Robinson - backing vocals * Jeff Davis - backing vocals * [[John Cuniberti]] - engineer, mixer * [[Winston Smith (artist)|Winston Smith]] - artwork |} {{Dead Kennedys}} {{Jello Biafra}} [[Category:1985 albums]] [[Category:Alternative Tentacles albums]] [[Category:Dead Kennedys albums]] [[Category:Censorship of music]] [[Category:Obscenity controversies]] [[Category:Albums with cover art by H. R. Giger]]
